options.C: It is the value that occurs most frequently.
options.D: It is the middle value in the sorted dataset.

24.question: What does the 'mode' represent in a dataset?

options.A: The value that occurs most frequently

options.C: The relationship varies depending on the dataset size.

28.question: What is the Inter-quartile range (IQR) defined as?

options.B: The sum of the 25th and 75th percentiles.
options.C: The difference between the maximum and minimum values.
options.D: The range between the first and third quartiles (Q3 - Q1).

29.question: A value is typically considered an outlier if it falls outside of what range relative to the IQR?

options.A: Higher or lower than 1.5 times the IQR from Q3 or Q1.
options.B: Within 0.5 times the IQR from the median.
options.C: Exactly 2 times the IQR from the mean.
options.D: Any value that is not the mean, median, or mode.

30.question: Which components make up the 'Five-number summary' of a distribution?

options.B: Mean, Median, Mode, Variance, Standard Deviation

31.question: How is standard deviation related to variance?

options.A: Standard deviation is unrelated to variance.
options.B: Standard deviation is the square root of the variance.
options.C: Standard deviation is the square of the variance.
options.D: Standard deviation is always smaller than variance.
